intro: Melicope lunu-ankenda, commonly known as the Ceylon mahogany, is a tropical tree native to the island of Sri Lanka. It belongs to the Rutaceae family and is characterized by its dark, aromatic wood that is highly valued for its durability and fine grain. The plant has simple, alternate leaves that are usually elliptic in shape and have a smooth surface. It produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are followed by small, round fruits containing a single seed. The tree is often found in moist, well-drained soils in lowland and hill forest areas.
